original: Karlsson, Johan Wilhelm, lasaretts-syssloman, Kadisikrona, i. 14/4/90 i Ryssby, Kronob. 1., av Karl Andersson o. Anna Maria Karls^son. G. 20 m. Karin Jacobsson. — Underoff :ex. MiHtäranst. 09-30, las :syssloman v. Karlskrona las. sed. 30. Led. av 16-nendn f. Karfekrona stad samt rev. f. stadens räkenisk. Svm, Blek. skytte-förb. för t j GM. Carlsson, Karl John Eugén, direktör, Göteborg, f. 5/11/92 i Gräve, Örebro 1., av August C. o. Emma Anders-fsoin. G. 24 m. Irmta Ericisson. Biarn: John-Sture Nottorp f. 26, dir. f. A-B Förbandsmaterial, Gbg. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 13, stud. i Tyskl., Engl. o. USA, res :off :.ex. 16. Övertog Sca-nia-Vabis rör. i Gbg 21, inneh. av Gbgs Bil A-B sed. 27, inneh. Ford-agenturen i Gbg 27-37, repr. f. Dodge o. DKW f. Philipsons Bil A-B 37-40. Tillh. IFK Gbg sed. 10, kndsiliagspel:. i fotboM m. translated: Karlsson, Johan Wilhelm, hospital clerk, Kadisikrona, b. 14/4/90 in Ryssby, Kronob. 1st, son of Karl Andersson and Anna Maria Karlsson. Married on 20th with Karin Jacobsson. — Underwent military training at Hälsingtornanst. from 1909 to 1930, serving as hospital clerk at Karlskrona hospital since 1930. Member of the 16th division of the Karfekrona city council and city auditor. Member of the Blekinge marksmanship association as well. Carlsson, Karl John Eugén, director, Gothenburg, b. 5/11/92 in Gräve, Örebro, son of August C. and Emma Andersfson. Married on 24th with Irmta Ericisson. Children: John-Sture Nottorp b. 26, director of A-B Förbandsmaterial, Gothenburg. Completed high school studies at Göteborgs h. latin in 1913, studied in Germany, England, and the USA, became reserve officer in 1916. Took over Scania-Vabis business in Gothenburg in 1921, became owner of Gbgs Bil A-B since 1927, held Ford agency in Gothenburg from 1927 to 1937, represented Dodge and DKW for Philipsons Bil A-B from 1937 to 1940. Member of IFK Gothenburg since 1910, played football matches against Norway in 1913 and 1914, England in 1914, Hungary in 1914, and Denmark twice in 1915, as well as in 1916, 1917, and 1918. Hobbies: hunting, fishing.
